meanings.definition: A Japanese syllabary used for writing foreign words and names.
meanings.sent1: I learned to write my name in katakana.
meanings.sent2: In Japanese class, we practiced writing katakana characters.
meanings.sent3: The katakana characters looked like little puzzles to me.
meanings.sent4: Her name in katakana was like a secret code on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's demonstration of katakana was clear and easy to follow.

meanings.sent1: The katakana on the sign was easy to read.
meanings.sent2: I like the design of katakana characters.
meanings.sent3: The katakana letters danced across the page.
meanings.sent4: The katakana symbols stood out boldly against the background.
meanings.sent5: The book cover was decorated with colorful katakana.
